name: BEST WESTERN Europa Hotel

reviews.text: We stayed for two nights in Hotel Europa and we didn’t want to leave, it was that good. If you have been to Olympia, you will know it’s a town built for tourists visiting the Olympia ruin, with one main street that’s half mile long filled with tourist shops, touristy restaurants and small hotels (some of them seem to be very run down), one end of the main street is the bus station, and the other end is the Olympia ruin. Hotel Europa is at the hilltop overlooking the Olympia town (3 minute drive into the town or 10 minute walk down the hill and 20 minute walk back up the hill, so drive if you have a car, parking is free and plenty in town) and it felt more like a resort with its onsite restaurants (more on that later), large guest rooms with full amenities, outdoor pool (large for a hotel pool) and pool side drink and food services. If you are going to visit Olympia in the future, stay at Hotel Europa, there is nothing like it in town, eat at the hotel restaurant, it’s rated No. 1 on tripadvisor for restaurants in Olympia.
reviews.title: Best hotel in Olympia

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everyone we ran into were super helpful and friendly (and speak good English). The breakfast buffet has a huge spread of food choices. The best part of the hotel is the restaurant in the garden. We tried what was on the printed menu and what was on the daily special list, everything was simply great. If you go there, you have to try the “farm dish”, it’s made with local cheese and vegetables they grow in the garden (and I am of the type that considers vegetables should only be side dishes to a slab of meat). They recommended reservations and I could see why. We ate there both nights and the place was full on both nights. It was a mixture of hotel guests and locals coming here for a special meal. To make the reservation, we walked out to the garden and picked a not-yet-reserved table that we wanted. For our second night dinner, we booked a day ahead and picked the table that had a great view of the sunset and the valley, it made our second dinner even better. The price was unbelievably inexpensive for an onsite restaurant in a 4 star hotel, its price was equivalent or even cheaper than many of the small family restaurants that we tried in Greece.
reviews.title: Better than USA locations
Total relax in a fabulous location
reviews.text: Don't think Best Western USA. This is a lovingly run by a local family who produce their own vegetables and use them as the centerpiece in their attractive on-site taverna. Guests have first choice of tables perfect for watching the sunset. Many of the rooms have excellent views down to the valley, but more important is the pool large enough to accommodate real swimmers and kids having fun.

I don't know where to start. Maybe from the location (on the top of the hill dominating Olympia), or from the swimming pool (surrounded by olive trees, wisteria, orange trees and other beautiful plants); maybe from the super-friendly staff (receptionists, barmen, pool-guard, all), or from the spacious and clean rooms. No matter where to start (I forgot to write about the best breakfast ever found in an hotel with home made jams, cakes, yogurt just to mention any treat), it was a very pleasure stay. I also recommend the taverna, having your dinner under the olive trees with an amazing landscape!
reviews.title: You'll wish you had booked an extra night

reviews.text: Although one day is enough to visit Olympia, do yourself a favor and book a second night at this excellent hotel. You will love the pool, the outdoor barbecue restaurant with a view (and great food), the nice rooms (and best hotel shower ever), the service, the rooftop breakfast terrace...
reviews.title: Hotel to remember

reviews.text: We just stayed at this lovely hotel situated on top of a mountain of ancient olympia and must say that we are quite satisfied..aa Its got a nice big pool with spacious decking area...very well kept turf..fruit trees all over the place..apple trees, peach trees, plum trees...you name it u see it :) The Taverna is very sweet with lots of character and brilliant tranquil atmosphere. Food is delicious although we prefered diner since there is the grills being cooked on a big bbq.staff very friendly. Breakfast with a very good selection of anything you might feel like in the morning..must not forget to point out that jams which are home made and very tasty. Rooms are very clean..we being 5 members in the family would have preferred a bigger room however we did not ask for it. I'm sure we would hve been served to it. We do recommend this hotel alot.
reviews.title: A very nice hotel with attention to detail being impressive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent a couple of nights in July at this lovely hotel. The staff were very welcoming and extremely helpful. The room and facilities, especially the garden restaurant, were excellent. We would thoroughly recommend it to others.
reviews.title: A lovely base to visit Olympia

reviews.text: We were a bit Leary at first of booking this hotel. We needed a hotel to stop at between, Costa Navarino and Litchoro(Mt Olympus) and decided this was the one based on Trip advisor reviews.We were very pleased with our stay.
reviews.title: Great hotel in a great spot

reviews.text: The rooms were clean and large. We had a great view over the Mountains as the hotel sits on a large hill top. The BBQ restaurant outback was very good and the service was friendly and prompt. The dinning is outdoors and the views are spectacular over the mountains .
reviews.title: excellent hotel, good service, fabulous restaurant

reviews.text: The pool is very large with a pool bar service. The frozen drinks were great. The front desk staff were very friendly and hospitable.they even gave us a jar of home made marmalade upon check out. This hotel is about 5 minutes from the historical area and downtown Olympia. We did a private tour of Olympia with Nikki and she was amazing!highly recommend the tour of both the sight of olympia and the museum which has incredible artifacts inside it.
reviews.title: Very good hotel
The "best" value Best Western.
reviews.text: Okay, it not in the center of town, but who cares. New Olympia is a dump, and its a 2 minute drive to what you are here to see, the ruins.

The rooms are very large by European standards. Our room had a good sized double bed and a nice sitting area. The balcony had a good view over the pool area (we were on the second floor). The bathroom was modest but clean.
reviews.title: A dream; stay here; eat here

reviews.text: The pool area is fantastic by European standards. The pool was clean, and drinks readily available.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel

reviews.text: The restaurant deserves a mention. The food is mainly traditional Greek (souvlaki, fish, etc...). It's not the best value you'll find in greece, but the quality was very good. I didn't see anything in the town that compelled me to leave the hotel restaurant.
reviews.title: Very good

reviews.text: But the most important thing about this hotel is the price. I can't remember he last time I stayed in a hotel im europe that was this nice for less than 100 euros.
reviews.title: Wonderful restaurant

reviews.text: After a long day on a bus tour we were looking froward to a quick dip in the hotel pool. What a pleasant surprise to find such a nice area and a large well kept pool. Our room was on the ground floor with nice garden views. Room was clean & bedding in good condition. Double bed was very comfortable with firm pillows.
reviews.title: Nice one
It's not a 4 stars hotel
reviews.text: Evening meal & breakfast were included in our package. The evening meal was a buffet style affair in the lovely garden area. Food was fresh and well cooked, although I did miss out on some of the better selections of desserts. Very pleasant sitting outside in the garden enjoying a very good meal with plenty of friendly & helpful staff.
Breakfast was inside and had all the normal fare.
reviews.title: Great Olympia Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is not 4 stars hotel by any mean. Rude staff and very old furniture that doesn't match what we paid for. I don't really recommend it as you can find cheaper hotels for the same service or even better
reviews.title: A first rate experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went to the Resturant beside the swimming pool where the view is amazing and they didn't let us in for a drink and they said its only for dinner though half of the restaurant was empty. No coffee machine or water heater or coffee in the room. No complementary water as well. In summery I don't recommend this place and lucky I am not coming back here again.
reviews.title: faultless

description: A member of the Best Western Group of hotels. The Europa Hotel is set among the enchanting landscape of Ancient Olympia. It is ideally located to visit the important sites of the area and enjoy the natural beauty of the mountain and coast of West Peloponnese.
